bitmark:
[.book]
[@id:216190]
[@externalId:e-passiv-grammatikbungen_ssjjcw0vookg]
[#Passiv – Grammatikübungen]
[@language:de]
[@coverImage:https://docs.bitmark.cloud/bit-books/englisch-hilfen/web-resources/images/englischhilfen_grammatik_cover.png]

[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:216191]
[%Nr. 2732]
[!Schreibe die Passivsätze ins Aktiv.]
1. The bag was packed by his mother.
[_His mother packed the bag.]
2. Football is played by the children.
[_The children play football.]
3. Coffee is sold by Marie.
[_Marie sells coffee.]
4. The exercise is completed by the teacher.
[_The teacher completes the exercise.]
5. This book was written by an Irishman.
[_An Irishman wrote this book.]
6. The club was founded by Ron and Peggy.
[_Ron and Peggy founded the club.]
7. The computer is used by Patrick.
[_Patrick uses the computer.]
8. The telephone was invented by Alexander Graham Bell.
[_Alexander Graham Bell invented the telephone.]
9. The president was elected by the people.
[_The people elected the president.]
10. The child was hit by a car.
[_A car hit the child.]

bit.instruction: Schreibe die Passivsätze ins Aktiv.

solutions: Ron and Peggy founded the club.
Alexander Graham Bell invented the telephone.

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice:bitmark--]
[@id:216192]
[%2732]
[!Stehen die Sätze im Aktiv oder im Passiv?]
===
[!1. They often read e-mails.]
[+Aktiv]
[-Passiv]
===
[!2. Lots of houses were destroyed.]
[-Aktiv]
[+Passiv]
===
[!3. They are listening to their music.]
[+Aktiv]
[-Passiv]
===
[!4. Bingo is played in Britain.]
[-Aktiv]
[+Passiv]
===
[!5. He lost his keys yesterday.]
[+Aktiv]
[-Passiv]
===
[!6. The bus driver was hurt.]
[-Aktiv]
[+Passiv]
===
[!7. Steven likes to play baseball.]
[+Aktiv]
[-Passiv]
===
[!8. These cars are produced in Italy.]
[-Aktiv]
[+Passiv]
===
[!9. A letter was written.]
[-Aktiv]
[+Passiv]
===
[!10. French is spoken in Niger.]
[-Aktiv]
[+Passiv]
===

bit.instruction: Stehen die Sätze im Aktiv oder im Passiv?

quizzes.instruction: 1. They often read e-mails.
2. Lots of houses were destroyed.
3. They are listening to their music.
4. Bingo is played in Britain.
5. He lost his keys yesterday.
6. The bus driver was hurt.
7. Steven likes to play baseball.
8. These cars are produced in Italy.
9. A letter was written.
10. French is spoken in Niger.

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:216193]
[%2732]
[!Schreibe die Aktivsätze ins Passiv.]
1. The teacher closes the window.
[_The window is closed.]
2. The girls can play handball
[_Handball can be played.]
3. Levi Strauss invented the blue jeans.
[_The blue jeans were invented.]
4. Frank takes photos.
[_Photos are taken.]
5. The electricians test the fire alarm.
[_The fire alarm is tested.]
6. The mechanic repairs cars.
[_Cars are repaired.]
7. John cleaned the bathroom.
[_The bathroom was cleaned.]
8. My friend bought a new car.
[_A new car was bought.]
9. They understand Spanish.
[_Spanish is understood.]
10. The dog did not bite the cat.
[_The cat was not bitten.]

bit.instruction: Schreibe die Aktivsätze ins Passiv.

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:216194]
[%2732]
[!Bilde Wortgruppen aus den Verbformen im Passiv. Beachte die Zeitformen in Klammern.]
1. films / to watch __(Simple Present)__
[_films are watched]
2. songs / to sing __(Simple Past)__
[_songs were sung]
3. stories / to tell __(Simple Present)__
[_stories are told]
4. English / to speak __(Simple Present)__
[_English is spoken]
5. a prize / to win __(Simple Past)__
[_a prize was won]
6. computer games / to buy __(Simple Present)__
[_computer games are bought]
7. skateboards / to ride __(Simple Past)__
[_skateboards were ridden]
8. posters / to make __(Simple Present)__
[_posters are made]
9. books / to write __(Simple Past)__
[_books were written]
10. volleyball / to play __(Simple Past)__
[_volleyball was played]

bit.instruction: Bilde Wortgruppen aus den Verbformen im Passiv. Beachte die Zeitformen in Klammern.

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:216195]
[%Nr. 2734]
[!Schreibe die Aktivsätze ins Passiv.]
1. Rick told Sue to give up smoking.
[_Sue was told to give up smoking.]
2. They develop an environmentally friendly type of washing powder.
[_An environmentally friendly type of washing powder is developed.]
3. The professor is going to show the students an old bone.
[_The students are going to be shown an old bone.]
4. Snow covered the mountains.
[_The mountains were covered with snow.]
5. The lady gave me the keys.
[_I was given the keys.]
6. Who said it?
[_It was said by whom?]
7. People said that the President is ill.
[_It was said that the President is ill.]
8. Jack has installed a new computer software.
[_A new computer software has been installed.]
9. They expected us to build the road.
[_We were expected to build the road.]
10. We must write to her.
[_She must be written to.]

bit.instruction: Schreibe die Aktivsätze ins Passiv.

solutions: Sue was told to give up smoking.
An environmentally friendly type of washing powder is developed.
The students are going to be shown an old bone.
The mountains were covered with snow.
It was said that the President is ill.
A new computer software has been installed.
We were expected to build the road.

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:216196]
[%Nr. 2734]
[!Wähle die richtigen Passivformen aus.]
1. The manager [-should been told][+should has been told][+should have been told] about the problem.
2. [+I was given the books.][-I were given the books.][-The books were me given.]
3. I [+was let go][-was let go to][-was let to go].
4. The project of form 8 [-is said to fail][-is said to be failed][+is said to have failed].
5. The homework [+must be done][-was done][-will be made] by tomorrow.
6. The first computer [-is invented][+was invented][-will be invented] in the 1940's.
7. [-She is supposed be in New Orleans][+She is supposed to be in New Orleans][-She is supposed to being in New Orleans].
8. Yesterday a boy [-has been injured][+was injured][-will be injured] in an accident in High Street.
9.  She [-are invited][+has been invited][-have been invited] to Jack's birthday party.
10. [-The note was written what with?][+What was the note written with][-With what was the note written?]?

bit.body:
1. The manager {0} about the problem.
2. {1}
3. I {2}.
4. The project of form 8 {3}.
5. The homework {4} by tomorrow.
6. The first computer {5} in the 1940's.
7. {6}.
8. Yesterday a boy {7} in an accident in High Street.
9.  She {8} to Jack's birthday party.
10. {9}?

options.text: She is supposed be in New Orleans
She is supposed to be in New Orleans
She is supposed to being in New Orleans
The note was written what with?
What was the note written with
With what was the note written?

bit.instruction: Wähle die richtigen Passivformen aus.

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:216197]
[%Nr. 2734]
[!Bilde Wortgruppen aus den Verbformen im Passiv. Beachte die Zeitformen in Klammern.]
1. the road / to close __(Conditional Simple)__
[_the road would be closed]
2. the computers / to replace __(Past Progressive)__
[_the computers were being replaced]
3. astronauts / to send to the moon __(will-future)__
[_astronauts will be sent to the moon]
4. the classrooms / to use __(Past Perfect)__
[_the classrooms had been used]
5. eggs / to boil __(Simple Past)__
[_eggs were boiled]
6. the penguins / to feed __(Future Perfect)__
[_the penguins will have been fed]
7. my house / to break in __(Present Perfect)__
[_my house has been broken into]
8. the table / to lay __(will-future)__
[_the table will be laid]
9. children / to see in the park __(Simple Past)__
[_children were seen in the park]
10. the cars / to repair __(Present Perfect)__
[_the cars have been repaired]

bit.instruction: Bilde Wortgruppen aus den Verbformen im Passiv. Beachte die Zeitformen in Klammern.

solutions: astronauts will be sent to the moon
the penguins will have been fed
my house has been broken into
children were seen in the park

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice:bitmark--]
[@id:216198]
[%Nr. 2734]
[!In welcher Zeitform stehen die folgenden Passivsätze?]
===
[!1. The tiger would be kept in the zoo.]
[+Conditional Simple]
[-Present Progressive]
[-Simple Present]
[-will-future]
===
[!2. The patient is being prepared for the major operation.]
[-Present Perfect]
[-Present Perfect Progressive]
[+Present Progressive]
[-Simple Present]
===
[!3. The old vessel was being towed into harbour.]
[-Past Perfect]
[+Past Progressive]
[-Present Perfect Progressive]
[-Simple Past]
===
[!4. The dog is being taken to the vet's.]
[-Present Perfect]
[-Present Perfect Progressive]
[+Present Progressive]
[-Simple Present]
===
[!5. My car was broken into yesterday.]
[-Conditional Simple]
[-Past Perfect]
[-Present Perfect]
[+Simple Past]
===
[!6. A song is going to be sung.]
[+going to-future]
[-Past Progressive]
[-Present Progressive]
[-will-future]
===
[!7. The president will be elected.]
[-Conditional Simple]
[-Present Progressive]
[-Simple Present]
[+will-future]
===
[!8. I'm being watched.]
[-going to-future]
[-Past Progressive]
[+Present Progressive]
[-will-future]
===
[!9. The people had not been warned by the coastguards.]
[+Past Perfect]
[-Present Perfect]
[-Simple Past]
[-Simple Present]
===
[!10. The new computer chip will be produced in Dresden.]
[-Present Perfect]
[-Simple Past]
[-Simple Present]
[+will-future]
===

bit.instruction: In welcher Zeitform stehen die folgenden Passivsätze?

quizzes.instruction: 1. The tiger would be kept in the zoo.
2. The patient is being prepared for the major operation.
3. The old vessel was being towed into harbour.
4. The dog is being taken to the vet's.
5. My car was broken into yesterday.
6. A song is going to be sung.
7. The president will be elected.
8. I'm being watched.
9. The people had not been warned by the coastguards.
10. The new computer chip will be produced in Dresden.

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:216199]
[%Nr. 2710]
[!Entscheide, ob der Satz im **Aktiv** oder im **Passiv** steht.
**Die Verbformen sind hervorgehoben.**]
1. They often **listen** to music. → [+Aktiv][-Passiv]
2. She **is reading** the newspaper now. → [+Aktiv][-Passiv]
3. These cars **are produced** in Japan. → [-Aktiv][+Passiv]
4. Alan **teaches** geography. → [+Aktiv][-Passiv]
5. German **is spoken** in Austria. → [-Aktiv][+Passiv]
6. Lots of houses **were destroyed** by the earthquake in 1906. → [-Aktiv][+Passiv]
7. Henry Ford **invented** the assembly line. → [+Aktiv][-Passiv]
8. The bus driver **was hurt** yesterday. → [-Aktiv][+Passiv]
9. You **should open** your workbooks. → [+Aktiv][-Passiv]
10. Houses **have been built**. → [-Aktiv][+Passiv]

bit.instruction:
Entscheide, ob der Satz im **Aktiv** oder im **Passiv** steht.
**Die Verbformen sind hervorgehoben.**

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:216200]
[%Nr. 2712]
[!Entscheide, ob der Satz im **Aktiv** oder im **Passiv** steht.]
1. Boys like to play soccer. → [+Aktiv][-Passiv]
2. This room has been painted blue. → [-Aktiv][+Passiv]
3. Cricket is played in Australia. → [-Aktiv][+Passiv]
4. I am given a book. → [-Aktiv][+Passiv]
5. We have lost our keys. → [+Aktiv][-Passiv]
6. You might see dolphins here. → [+Aktiv][-Passiv]
7. The report must be completed by next Friday. → [-Aktiv][+Passiv]
8. They were singing a song in the lesson yesterday. → [+Aktiv][-Passiv]
9. A letter was written to her some days ago. → [-Aktiv][+Passiv]
10. The black bike is being repaired at the moment. → [-Aktiv][+Passiv]

bit.instruction: Entscheide, ob der Satz im **Aktiv** oder im **Passiv** steht.

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:216201]
[%Nr. 2714]
[!Entscheide, ob der Satz im **Aktiv** oder im **Passiv** steht.]
1. The grapes are grown in California. → [-Aktiv][+Passiv]
2. The hamster can be kept in a cage. → [-Aktiv][+Passiv]
3. The party has already started. → [+Aktiv][-Passiv]
4. The car is standing at the garage. → [+Aktiv][-Passiv]
5. The ship has left the harbour. → [+Aktiv][-Passiv]
6. The police didn't find the robber last week. → [+Aktiv][-Passiv]
7. The first fast food restaurants were opened in the USA in 1916. → [-Aktiv][+Passiv]
8. The train is going to arrive late. → [+Aktiv][-Passiv]
9. The search will be stopped because of the storm. → [-Aktiv][+Passiv]
10. The friends have been looking forward to meeting her. → [+Aktiv][-Passiv]

bit.instruction: Entscheide, ob der Satz im **Aktiv** oder im **Passiv** steht.

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:216202]
[%Nr. 2724]
[!Setze die vorgegebenen Sätze ins Passiv.]
0. Peter writes letters.
[_Letters are written.][@example] __oder__ [_Letters are written by Peter.][@example]
1. Julia rescued three cats.
[_Three cats were rescued by Julia.]
2. The students handed in the reports.
[_The reports were handed in by the students.]
3. Maria crashed into the blue car.
[_The blue car was crashed into by Maria.]
4. Alex learned the poem.
[_The poem was learned by Alex.]
5. Steven has forgotten the book.
[_The book has been forgotten by Steven.]
6. The technician has not repaired the DVD recorder.
[_The DVD recorder has not been repaired by the technician.]
7. They play handball.
[_Handball is played.]
8. Sue puts the bag on the floor.
[_The bag is put on the floor by Sue.]
9. The girls had lost the match.
[_The match had been lost by the girls.]
10. The teacher is not going to open the window.
[_The window is not going to be opened by the teacher.]

bit.instruction: Setze die vorgegebenen Sätze ins Passiv.

solutions: Three cats were rescued by Julia.
The reports were handed in by the students.
The blue car was crashed into by Maria.
The poem was learned by Alex.
The book has been forgotten by Steven.
The DVD recorder has not been repaired by the technician.
The bag is put on the floor by Sue.
The match had been lost by the girls.
The window is not going to be opened by the teacher.

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:216203]
[%Nr. 2750]
[!Ordne die Verbformen den entsprechenden englischen **Zeitformen im Passiv** zu.]
1. is written → [-Past Perfect][-Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][+Simple Present][-will-future]
2. were sold → [-Past Perfect][-Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][+Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will-future]
3. have been played → [-Past Perfect][-Past Progressive][+Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will-future]
4. are recorded → [-Past Perfect][-Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][+Simple Present][-will-future]
5. will be showed → [-Past Perfect][-Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][+will-future]
6. had been built → [+Past Perfect][-Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will-future]
7. was made → [-Past Perfect][-Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][+Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will-future]
8. are being discussed → [-Past Perfect][-Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][+Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will-future]
9. has been done → [-Past Perfect][-Past Progressive][+Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will-future]
10. was being given → [-Past Perfect][+Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will-future]

bit.instruction: Ordne die Verbformen den entsprechenden englischen **Zeitformen im Passiv** zu.

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:216204]
[%Nr. 2752]
[!Ordne den Sätzen die entsprechenden englischen **Zeitformen im Passiv** zu.]
1. English **is spoken** in Australia. → [-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][+Simple Present][-will-future]
2. Two black cars **were stolen** last Thursday. → [-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][+Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will-future]
3. The suitcases **have** already **been packed**. → [+Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will-future]
4. The emails **will be sent** tomorrow. → [-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][+will-future]
5. The door **is being opened**. → [-Present Perfect][+Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will-future]
6. The Rocky Mountains **are known** for their scenery. → [-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][+Simple Present][-will-future]
7. A new hospital **has been opened** today. → [+Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will-future]
8. George **was stopped** by a policeman. → [-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][+Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will-future]
9. **Have** you ever **been bitten** by a dog? → [+Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will-future]
10. This room **won't be cleaned** today. → [-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][+will-future]

bit.instruction: Ordne den Sätzen die entsprechenden englischen **Zeitformen im Passiv** zu.

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:216205]
[%Nr. 2754]
[!Ordne den Sätzen (oder den Satzteilen) die entsprechenden englischen **Zeitformen im Passiv** zu.]
1. The windows were shut down before the storm. → [-Past Perfect][-Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][+Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will-future]
2. These phones are made in China. → [-Past Perfect][-Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][+Simple Present][-will-future]
3. You will be informed immediately. → [-Past Perfect][-Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][+will-future]
4. Has Ben been told? → [-Past Perfect][-Past Progressive][+Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will-future]
5. Jack wasn't paid much for arranging the song. → [-Past Perfect][-Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][+Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will-future]
6. The guests are being welcomed by the children. → [-Past Perfect][-Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][+Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will-future]
7. The old lady has been found alive and well in the park. → [-Past Perfect][-Past Progressive][+Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will-future]
8. Are you being served? → [-Past Perfect][-Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][+Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will-future]
9. She found that her money had been stolen. → [+Past Perfect][-Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will-future]
10. When Doris came to the office, new lights were being installed. → [-Past Perfect][+Past Progressive][-Present Perfect][-Present Progressive][-Simple Past][-Simple Present][-will-future]

bit.instruction: Ordne den Sätzen (oder den Satzteilen) die entsprechenden englischen **Zeitformen im Passiv** zu.

bitmark:
[.interview:bitmark--]
[@id:216206]
[%Nr. 1408]
[!Bilde aus folgenden Wörtern oder Wortgruppen **Fragen im Passiv**.]
===
[%0.] coffee, grown. in South America, is[@shortAnswer]
[@example:Is coffee grown in South America?]
===
[%1.] caught, the thieves, were[@shortAnswer]
[$Were the thieves caught?]
===
[%2.] written, the tests, in the language lab, always, are[@shortAnswer]
[$Are the tests always written in the language lab?]
===
[%3.] accepted, my apology, will, be[@shortAnswer]
[$Will my apology be accepted?]
===
[%4.] in Alaska, eagles, are, found[@shortAnswer]
[$Are eagles found in Alaska?]
===
[%5.] for the World Exhibition, in 1889, was, the Eiffel Tower, built[@shortAnswer]
[$Was the Eiffel Tower built for the World Exhibition in 1889?]
===
[%6.] replaced, will, be, the workers, by computers[@shortAnswer]
[$Will the workers be replaced by computers?]
===
[%7.] be, beans and carrots, cooked, can, together[@shortAnswer]
[$Can beans and carrots be cooked together?]
===
[%8.] yesterday, was, seen, the accident, by the police[@shortAnswer]
[$Was the accident seen by the police yesterday?]
===
[%9.] was, the first underground railway, opened, where[@shortAnswer]
[$Where was the first underground railway opened?]
===
[%10.] are, returned, the books, to the school, going to, be[@shortAnswer]
[$Are the books going to be returned to the school?]
===

bit.instruction: Bilde aus folgenden Wörtern oder Wortgruppen **Fragen im Passiv**.

questions.question: coffee, grown. in South America, is
questions.example: Is coffee grown in South America?

questions.question: caught, the thieves, were
questions.sampleSolution: Were the thieves caught?

questions.question: written, the tests, in the language lab, always, are
questions.sampleSolution: Are the tests always written in the language lab?

questions.question: accepted, my apology, will, be
questions.sampleSolution: Will my apology be accepted?

questions.question: in Alaska, eagles, are, found
questions.sampleSolution: Are eagles found in Alaska?

questions.question: for the World Exhibition, in 1889, was, the Eiffel Tower, built
questions.sampleSolution: Was the Eiffel Tower built for the World Exhibition in 1889?

questions.question: replaced, will, be, the workers, by computers
questions.sampleSolution: Will the workers be replaced by computers?

questions.question: be, beans and carrots, cooked, can, together
questions.sampleSolution: Can beans and carrots be cooked together?

questions.question: yesterday, was, seen, the accident, by the police
questions.sampleSolution: Was the accident seen by the police yesterday?

questions.question: was, the first underground railway, opened, where
questions.sampleSolution: Where was the first underground railway opened?

questions.question: are, returned, the books, to the school, going to, be
questions.sampleSolution: Are the books going to be returned to the school?

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:216208]
[%Nr. 2720]
[!Setze die richtige Passivform in die Lücke. **Das einzusetzende Verb und die Zeitform sind in Klammern vorgegeben.**]
0. Letters [_are written][@example] by Peter. __(to write → Simple Present)__
1. The words [_are explained][!to explain - Simple Present] by the teacher today. 
2. We [_were sent][!to send - Simple Past] a letter the day before yesterday. 
3. This car [_will not be stolen][!not/to steal - will-future]. It's too old. 
4. This street [_has already been closed][!already/to close - Present Perfect] because of snow. 
5. A new restaurant [_will be opened][!to open - will-future] next week. 
6. He [_was invited][!to invite - Simple Past] to the party yesterday. 
7. The blue box [_cannot be seen][!can/not/to see - Simple Present]. 
8. I [_was given][!to give - Simple Past] the book by my friend last Sunday.
9. The dishes [_have not been washed][!not/to wash - Present Perfect] by my little brother.
10. I [_will not be asked][!not/to ask - will-future] by Robert.

bit.body:
0. Letters {0} by Peter. __(to write → Simple Present)__
1. The words {1} by the teacher today. 
2. We {2} a letter the day before yesterday. 
3. This car {3}. It's too old. 
4. This street {4} because of snow. 
5. A new restaurant {5} next week. 
6. He {6} to the party yesterday. 
7. The blue box {7}. 
8. I {8} the book by my friend last Sunday.
9. The dishes {9} by my little brother.
10. I {10} by Robert.
bit.instruction: Setze die richtige Passivform in die Lücke. **Das einzusetzende Verb und die Zeitform sind in Klammern vorgegeben.**

[!Setze die richtige **Passivform** im **Simple Past** in die Lücke.]
0. The mobiles [_were turned off][@example]. __(to turn off)__
1. The meal [_was cooked][!to cook].
2. The trees [_were planted][!to plant].
3. The words [_were substituted][!to substitute].
4. The question [_was answered][!to answer].
5. The correct answers [_were ticked][!to tick].
6. The apps [_were downloaded][!to download].
7. The door [_was locked][!to lock].
8. The children [_were picked up][!to pick up].
9. The house [_was burnt down][!to burn down].
10. He [_was robbed][!to rob].

3. The words {3}.
4. The question {4}.

6. The apps {6}.
7. The door {7}.
8. The children {8}.
9. The house {9}.
10. He {10}.

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:216211]
[%Nr. 2726]
[!Übersetze die Sätze ins Englische.]
0. Ein Brief wurde gestern geschrieben.
[_A letter was written yesterday.][@example]
1. Das Auto wurde letzten Donnerstag gestohlen.
[_The car was stolen last Thursday.]
2. Häuser werden gebaut.
[_Houses are built.]
3. Ihm wurde eine Pepsi angeboten
[_He was offered a Pepsi.]
4. Tiere dürfen nicht gefüttert werden.
[_Animals must not be fed.]
5. Er wurde gestern im Laden gesehen.
[_He was seen in the shop yesterday.]
6. Sie wird ins Krankenhaus gebracht werden.
[_She will be taken to hospital.]
7. Das Volleyballspiel wurde verloren.
[_The volleyball match has been lost.]
8. Das Mittagessen wird gerade gekocht.
[_Lunch is being cooked.]
9. Der Präsident wurde gewählt.
[_The President has been elected.]
10. Glühlampen wurden 1879 erfunden.
[_Light bulbs were invented in 1879.]

bit.instruction: Übersetze die Sätze ins Englische.

solutions: The car was stolen last Thursday.
He was seen in the shop yesterday.
She will be taken to hospital.
The volleyball match has been lost.

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:216212]
[%Nr. 2746]
[!Setze die vorgegebenen Sätze und Fragen ins Passiv.]
0. We have finished the housework.
[_The housework has been finished.][@example] __oder__
[_The housework has been finished by us.][@example]
1. They have opened a new shop.
[_A new shop has been opened.]
2. Rick has interviewed the lady.
[_The lady has been interviewed.]
3. I have bought the tickets.
[_The tickets have been bought.]
4. We have not sold the bike.
[_The bike has not been sold.]
5. Tim has forgotten the sandwiches.
[_The sandwiches have been forgotten.]
6. He has not cleaned the kitchen yet.
[_The kitchen has not been cleaned.]
7. Joe and Gerry have never played rugby.
[_Rugby has never been played.]
8. Somebody has stolen Peter's car.
[_Peter's car has been stolen.]
9. She has not used the tablet for days.
[_The tablet has not been used.]
10. Have they found the keys?
[_Have the keys been found?]

bit.instruction: Setze die vorgegebenen Sätze und Fragen ins Passiv.

solutions: The housework has been finished by us.
A new shop has been opened.
The bike has not been sold.
The kitchen has not been cleaned.
The tablet has not been used.

[_A comic is being read.]
2. We are cleaning the kitchen.
[_The kitchen is being cleaned.]

[_Dinner is not being made.]

[_The presents are being opened.]

[_Is a song being sung?]

[_The bags are being packed.]

[_Handball is not being played.]

[_A house was built by Frank.][@example]

[_Four apples were bought.]
2. We won the match.
[_The match was won.]
3. The man stole the blue car.
[_The blue car was stolen.]
4. The police arrested the thieves.
[_The thieves were arrested.]
5. Jack swam the 200 metres.
[_The 200 metres were swum.]
6. The dog bit the old lady.
[_The old lady was bitten.]
7. Tom and Max ate five hamburgers.
[_Five hamburgers were eaten.]
8. Oliver taught the children.
[_The children were taught.]
9. Victoria rode the brown horse.
[_The brown horse was ridden.]
10. Grandmother told good stories.
[_Good stories were told.]

solutions: A house was built by Frank.

bitmark:

[@id:216216]
[%Nr. 2748]
[!Setze die vorgegebenen Sätze und Fragen ins Passiv.]
0. They will release a new song.
[_A new song will be released.][@example] __oder__
[_A new song will be released by them.][@example]
1. Henry will drive Charlie home.
[_Charlie will be driven home.]
2. We will not send the tickets.
[_The tickets will not be sent.]
3. The bus driver will take the tourists to the hotel.
[_The tourists will be taken to the hotel.]
4. Will Oliver cancel the meeting?
[_Will the meeting be cancelled?]
5. I will answer the questions later.
[_The questions will be answered later.]
6. Ella will not print invitation cards.
[_Invitation cards will not be printed.]
7. We will play frisbee in the park.
[_Frisbee will be played in the park.]
8. Will she open the conference?
[_Will the conference be opened?]
9. The mayor will not close the hospital.
[_The hospital will not be closed.]
10. The doctor will examine the patient.
[_The patient will be examined.]

bit.instruction: Setze die vorgegebenen Sätze und Fragen ins Passiv.

solutions: A new song will be released.
A new song will be released by them.
The tickets will not be sent.
The tourists will be taken to the hotel.
The questions will be answered later.
Invitation cards will not be printed.
Frisbee will be played in the park.
The hospital will not be closed.

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:216217]
[%Nr. 2722]
[!Setze die vorgegebenen Sätze ins Passiv. Manchmal gibt es mehrere Möglichkeiten, da im Aktivsatz zwei verschiedene Objekte zu finden sind.
Verwende **keine** Kurzformen.]
0. Tim gave Lisa some flowers.
[_Some flowers were given to Lisa by Tim.][@example] __oder__
[_Lisa was given some flowers by Tim.][@example]
1. They don't speak English in this shop.
[_English is not spoken in this shop.]
2. Kevin asked Dennis a question.
[_Dennis was asked a question by Kevin.]
3. Somebody built the house last year.
[_The house was built last year.]
4. She gives him a box.
[_He is given a box.]
5. Max will look after him.
[_He will be looked after by Max.]
6. The waiter brought Fred a big steak.
[_A big steak was brought to Fred.]
7. Somebody broke into our bungalow last Friday.
[_Our bungalow was broken into last Friday.]
8. The teacher told us a joke.
[_We were told a joke by the teacher.]
9. They will meet Doris at the station.
[_Doris will be met at the station.]
10. Michael has not sent me the file.
[_I have not been sent the file by Michael.]

bit.instruction:
Setze die vorgegebenen Sätze ins Passiv. Manchmal gibt es mehrere Möglichkeiten, da im Aktivsatz zwei verschiedene Objekte zu finden sind.
Verwende **keine** Kurzformen.

solutions: Some flowers were given to Lisa by Tim.
Lisa was given some flowers by Tim.
English is not spoken in this shop.
Dennis was asked a question by Kevin.
The house was built last year.
He will be looked after by Max.
A big steak was brought to Fred.
Our bungalow was broken into last Friday.
We were told a joke by the teacher.
Doris will be met at the station.
I have not been sent the file by Michael.
